answerText: "Batter My Heart, Three-Person'd God" [or Holy Sonnet XIV][10] "Batter My Heart, Three-Person'd God" is one of the Holy Sonnets by this English poet of "A Valediction: Forbidding Mourning".
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | NYU A + MSU + Caltech A | 19 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poem states that "Yet dearly I love you, and would be loved fain / But am betroth'd unto your enemy." For 10 points each: [10] Identify this sonnet that asks the title figure to "break, blow, burn, and make me new". Its speaker tells the title figure: "I / Except you enthrall me, never shall be free / Nor ever chaste, except you ravish me."
